<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFU.S._Census2010">U.S. Census (April 2010). <a class="external text" href="https://www.census.gov/hhes/socdemo/language/data/other/detailed-lang-tables.xls" rel="nofollow">"Table 1. Detailed Languages Spoken at Home and Ability to Speak English for the Population 5 Years and Over for the United States: 2006–2008"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(MS-Excel Spreadsheet)</span>. <i>American Community Survey Data on Language Use</i>. Washington, DC, USA: <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">U.S. Census Bureau</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 7,</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=American+Community+Survey+Data+on+Language+Use&amp;rft.atitle=Table+1.+Detailed+Languages+Spoken+at+Home+and+Ability+to+Speak+English+for+the+Population+5+Years+and+Over+for+the+United+States%3A+2006%E2%80%932008&amp;rft.date=2010-04&amp;rft.au=U.S.+Census&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.census.gov%2Fhhes%2Fsocdemo%2Flanguage%2Fdata%2Fother%2Fdetailed-lang-tables.xls&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHawaiian+language"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation thesis cs1" id="CITEREFWarner1996">Warner, Sam L. (1996). <i>I Ola ka ʻŌlelo i nā Keiki: Ka ʻApo ʻia ʻana o ka ʻŌlelo Hawaiʻi e nā Keiki ma ke Kula Kaiapuni. [That the Language Live through the Children: The Acquisition of the Hawaiian Language by the Children in the Immersion School.]</i> (Ph.D. thesis). University of Hawaiʻi. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/38455191" rel="nofollow">38455191</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Adissertation&amp;rft.title=I+Ola+ka+%CA%BB%C5%8Clelo+i+n%C4%81+Keiki%3A+Ka+%CA%BBApo+%CA%BBia+%CA%BBana+o+ka+%CA%BB%C5%8Clelo+Hawai%CA%BBi+e+n%C4%81+Keiki+ma+ke+Kula+Kaiapuni.+%5BThat+the+Language+Live+through+the+Children%3A+The+Acquisition+of+the+Hawaiian+Language+by+the+Children+in+the+Immersion+School.%5D&amp;rft.degree=Ph.D.&amp;rft.inst=University+of+Hawai%CA%BBi&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F38455191&amp;rft.aulast=Warner&amp;rft.aufirst=Sam+L.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHawaiian+language"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFWight2005">Wight, Kahikāhealani (2005). <i>Learn Hawaiian at Home</i>. <a href="/wiki/Bess_Press" title="Bess Press">Bess Press</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/1-57306-245-6" title="Special:BookSources/1-57306-245-6"><bdi>1-57306-245-6</bdi></a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/76789116" rel="nofollow">76789116</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Learn+Hawaiian+at+Home&amp;rft.pub=Bess+Press&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F76789116&amp;rft.isbn=1-57306-245-6&amp;rft.aulast=Wight&amp;rft.aufirst=Kahik%C4%81healani&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHawaiian+language"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation thesis cs1" id="CITEREFWilson1976">Wilson, William H. (1976). <i>The <b>O</b> and <b>A</b> Possessive Markers in Hawaiian</i> (M.A. thesis). University of Hawaiʻi. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/16326934" rel="nofollow">16326934</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Adissertation&amp;rft.title=The+O+and+A+Possessive+Markers+in+Hawaiian&amp;rft.degree=M.A.&amp;rft.inst=University+of+Hawai%CA%BBi&amp;rft.date=1976&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F16326934&amp;rft.aulast=Wilson&amp;rft.aufirst=William+H.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHawaiian+language"></span></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Hawaiian_language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=35" title="Edit section: External links">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<table class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" role="presentation" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tbody><tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="94" data-file-width="103" decoding="async" height="37" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/80/Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg/40px-Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/80/Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg/60px-Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/80/Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg/80px-Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg.png 2x" width="40"/></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist"><i><b><a class="extiw" href="https://haw.wikipedia.org/wiki/" title="haw:"> Hawaiian  edition</a></b></i> of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia" title="Wikipedia">Wikipedia</a>, the free encyclopedia</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<table class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" role="presentation" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tbody><tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="800" decoding="async" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Incubator-logo.svg/32px-Incubator-logo.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Incubator-logo.svg/48px-Incubator-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Incubator-logo.svg/64px-Incubator-logo.svg.png 2x" width="32"/></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist"><i><b><a class="extiw" href="https://incubator.wikimedia.org/wiki/Wt/haw" title="incubator:Wt/haw">Hawaiian language test</a></b></i> of <a href="/wiki/Wiktionary" title="Wiktionary">Wiktionary</a> at <a class="extiw" href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Wikimedia_Incubator" title="meta:Wikimedia Incubator">Wikimedia Incubator</a></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<table class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" role="presentation" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tbody><tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="193" data-file-width="193" decoding="async" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/40px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/60px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/80px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png 2x" width="40"/></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist">Wikivoyage has a travel guide for <i><b><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wikivoyage.org/wiki/Hawaiian_phrasebook#Q33569" title="wikivoyage:Hawaiian phrasebook">Hawaiian phrasebook</a></b></i>.</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<table class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" role="presentation" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tbody><tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="400" decoding="async" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg/40px-Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg/60px-Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg/80px-Wikibooks-logo-en-noslogan.svg.png 2x" width="40"/></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist">Wikibooks has a book on the topic of: <i><b><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Hawaiian" title="wikibooks:Hawaiian">Hawaiian</a></b></i></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<ul><li><a class="external text" href="http://niuolahiki.ahapunanaleo.org" rel="nofollow">Niuolahiki Distance Learning Program</a> (a moodle-based online study program for Hawaiian)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20061203064044/http://ulukau.org/english.php" rel="nofollow">Ulukau – the Hawaiian electronic library</a>, includes English to/from Hawaiian dictionary</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.nupepa.org/" rel="nofollow">digitized Hawaiian language newspapers published between 1834 and 1948</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://wold.clld.org/vocabulary/30" rel="nofollow">Hawaiian Vocabulary List</a> (from the World Loanword Database)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.olelo.hawaii.edu/dual/orgs/keelikolani/" rel="nofollow">Ka Haka ʻUla O Keʻelikōlani, College of Hawaiian Language</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://ksdl.ksbe.edu/kulaiwi/" rel="nofollow">Kulaiwi</a> – learn Hawaiian through distance learning courses</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.hawaiian.saivus.org/" rel="nofollow">Hawaiian.saivus.org</a> – Detailed Hawaiian Language Pronunciation Guide</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160124232335/http://www.traditionalhawaiian.com/" rel="nofollow">Traditional and Neo Hawaiian: The Emergence of a New Form of Hawaiian Language as a Result of Hawaiian Language Regeneration</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100531191931/http://www.mauimagazine.net/Maui-Magazine/May-June-2008/Hale-Pai/" rel="nofollow">"Hale Pa'i"</a> Article about Hawaiian language newspapers printed at <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lahainaluna" title="Lahainaluna">Lahainaluna</a> on <a href="/wiki/Maui" title="Maui">Maui</a>. <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Maui_No_Ka_%27Oi_Magazine" title="Maui No Ka 'Oi Magazine">Maui No Ka 'Oi Magazine</a></i> Vol.12 No.3 (May 2008).</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.hawaiimagazine.com/blogs/hawaii_today/2010/5/12/new_iPhone_apps_help_speak_Hawaiian/" rel="nofollow">"Speak Hawaiian"'</a> Article about Hawaiian language resource on iPhone.  (May 2010).</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.friesian.com/hawaii.htm#pronounce" rel="nofollow">How to Pronounce "Hawai'i"</a>, Kelley L. Ross, Ph.D, 2008</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20111228042423/http://www.language-archives.org/language/haw" rel="nofollow">OLAC Resources in and about the Hawaiian language</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.honolulumagazine.com/Honolulu-Magazine/March-2012/Best-of-Honolulu-2012/Best-of-Honolulu-2012-Services/" rel="nofollow">"</a> Article about Hawaiian Dictionary resource on iPhone in Honolulu Magazine.  (May 2012).</li></ul>

aria-labelledby="23x16px&amp;#124;border_&amp;#124;alt=&amp;#124;link=_State_of_Hawaii" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1054937957" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Hawaii" title="Template:Hawaii"><abbr style="background-color:#F3D161;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Hawaii" title="Template talk:Hawaii"><abbr style="background-color:#F3D161;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Hawaii&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background-color:#F3D161;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="23x16px&amp;#124;border_&amp;#124;alt=&amp;#124;link=_State_of_Hawaii" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Flag_of_Hawaii.svg/35px-Flag_of_Hawaii.svg.png 1.5x, <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","name":"Hawaiian language","url":"https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Hawaiian_language","sameAs":"http:\/\/www.wikidata.org\/entity\/Q33569","mainEntity":"http:\/\/www.wikidata.org\/entity\/Q33569","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Contributors to Wikimedia projects"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.wikimedia.org\/static\/images\/wmf-hor-googpub.png"}},"datePublished":"2001-12-05T17:38:13Z","dateModified":"2021-12-14T16:02:45Z","headline":"Polynesian language spoken in Hawaii"}</script>

</html>
In [196]:
In [ ]:

STOPPED for THIS LECTURE¶

In [89]:
re.search('123', s)
s[3:6]
Out[89]:
'123'

[] Specifies a specific set of characters to match.

In [ ]:
re.search('ba[artz]', 'foobarqux')
In [ ]:
s = re.search('ba[artz]', 'foobarqux')
s.group(0)
In [ ]:
re.search('ba[artz]', 'foobazqux')

The metacharacter sequence [artz] matches any single 'a', 'r', 't', or 'z' character. In the example, the regex ba[artz] matches both 'bar' and 'baz' (and would also match 'baa' and 'bat')

In [ ]:

A character class can also contain a range of characters separated by a hyphen (-), in which case it matches any single character within the range. For example, [a-z] matches any lowercase alphabetic character between 'a' and 'z', inclusive:

In [ ]:
re.search('[a-z]', 'FOObar')

[0-9] matches any digit character:

In [ ]:
re.search('[0-9][0-9]', 'foo123bar')
In [ ]:
ans = re.search('[0-9][0-9]', 'foo123bar')
ans.group()

In this case, [0-9][0-9] matches a sequence of two digits. The first portion of the string 'foo123bar' that matches is '12'.

[0-9a-fA-F] matches any hexadecimal digit character

In [ ]:
re.search('[0-9a-fA-f]', '--- a0 ---')
In [ ]:
re.search('[^0-9]', '12345foo')
In [ ]:
re.search('[#:^]', 'foo^bar:baz#qux')
In [ ]:
re.search('[-abc]', '123-456')
In [ ]:
re.search('[abc-]', '123-456')
In [ ]:
re.search('[ab\-c]', '123-456')

If you want to include a literal ']' in a character class, then you can place it as the first character or escape it with backslash:

In [ ]:
re.search('[]]', 'foo[1]')
In [ ]:
re.search('[ab\]cd]', 'foo[1]')
In [ ]:
re.search('[)*+|]', '123*456')
In [ ]:
re.search('[)*+|]', '123+456')

(.) Specifies a wildcard.

In [ ]:
re.search('foo.bar', 'fooxbar')
In [ ]:
print(re.search('foo.bar', 'foobar'))
In [ ]:
print(re.search('foo.bar', 'foo\nbar'))

\w \W Match based on whether a character is a word character.

In [ ]:
re.search('\w', '#(.a$@&')
In [ ]:
re.search('[a-zA-Z0-9_]', '#(.a$@&')

In this case, the first word character in the string '#(.a$@&' is 'a'.

\W is the opposite. It matches any non-word character and is equivalent to [^a-zA-Z0-9_]:

In [ ]:
re.search('\W', 'a_1*3Qb')
In [ ]:
re.search('[^a-zA-Z0-9_]', 'a_1*3Qb')

Here, the first non-word character in 'a_13!b' is ''.

\d \D Match based on whether a character is a decimal digit.

\d matches any decimal digit character. \D is the opposite. It matches any character that isn’t a decimal digit:

In [ ]:
re.search('\d', 'abc4def')
In [ ]:
re.search('\D', '234Q678')

\d is essentially equivalent to [0-9], and \D is equivalent to [^0-9].

\s \S Match based on whether a character represents whitespace. \s matches any whitespace character

In [ ]:
re.search('\s', 'foo\nbar baz')

\S is opposite of \s

In [ ]:
re.search('\S', '  \n foo  \n  ')

Again, \s and \S consider a newline to be whitespace. In the example above, the first non-whitespace character is 'f'.

The character class sequences \w, \W, \d, \D, \s, and \S can appear inside a square bracket character class as well:

In [ ]:
re.search('[\d\w\s]', '---3---')
In [ ]:
re.search('[\d\w\s]', '---a---')
In [ ]:
re.search('[\d\w\s]', '--- ---')

backslash () Removes the special meaning of a metacharacter.

In [ ]:
re.search('.', 'foo.bar')
In [ ]:
re.search('\.', 'foo.bar')
In [ ]:
s = r'foo\bar'
print(s)
In [ ]:
re.search('\\', s)

Oops. What happened?

The problem here is that the backslash escaping happens twice, first by the Python interpreter on the string literal and then again by the regex parser on the regex it receives.

Here’s the sequence of events:

The Python interpreter is the first to process the string literal '\'. It interprets that as an escaped backslash and passes only a single backslash to re.search(). The regex parser receives just a single backslash, which isn’t a meaningful regex, so the messy error ensues.

In [ ]:
re.search('\\\\', s)
In [ ]:
ans = re.search('\\\\', s)
print(ans.group())

Doing so causes the following to happen:

The interpreter sees '\\' as a pair of escaped backslashes. It reduces each pair to a single backslash and passes '\' to the regex parser. The regex parser then sees \ as one escaped backslash. As a , that matches a single backslash character. You can see from the match object that it matched the backslash at index 3 in s as intended. It’s cumbersome, but it works.

^

\A Anchor a match to the start of .

When the regex parser encounters ^ or \A, the parser’s current position must be at the beginning of the search string for it to find a match.

In other words, regex ^foo stipulates that 'foo' must be present not just any old place in the search string, but at the beginning:

In [ ]:
re.search('^foo', 'foobar')
In [ ]:
print(re.search('^foo', 'barfoo'))

\A functions similarly

In [ ]:
re.search('\Afoo', 'foobar')
In [ ]:
#### finally first part Done
Searching Functions Searching functions scan a search string for one or more matches of the specified regex: Function Description re.search() Scans a string for a regex match re.match() Looks for a regex match at the beginning of a string re.fullmatch() Looks for a regex match on an entire string re.findall() Returns a list of all regex matches in a string re.finditer() Returns an iterator that yields regex matches from a string
In [ ]:
re.search(r'(\d+)', 'foo123bar')
In [ ]:
re.search(r'[a-z]+', '123FOO456', flags=re.IGNORECASE)
In [ ]:
print(re.search(r'\d+', 'foo.bar'))

The function returns a match object if it finds a match and None otherwise.

re.match(, , flags=0) Looks for a regex match at the beginning of a string.

In [ ]:
re.search(r'\d+', '123foobar')
In [ ]:
re.search(r'\d+', 'foo123bar')
In [ ]:
re.match(r'\d+', '123foobar')
In [ ]:
print(re.match(r'\d+', 'foo123bar'))
In [ ]:
s = 'foo\nbar\nbaz'
In [ ]:
re.search('^foo', s)
In [ ]:
re.search('^bar', s, re.MULTILINE)
In [ ]:
re.match('^foo', s)
In [ ]:
print(re.match('^bar', s, re.MULTILINE))

re.fullmatch(, , flags=0)

Looks for a regex match on an entire string.¶

In [ ]:
print(re.fullmatch(r'\d+', '123foo'))
In [ ]:
print(re.fullmatch(r'\d+', 'foo123'))
In [ ]:
print(re.fullmatch(r'\d+', 'foo123bar'))
In [ ]:
re.fullmatch(r'\d+', '123')
In [ ]:
re.search(r'^\d+$', '123')
In [ ]:
# re.findall(<regex>, <string>, flags=0)
In [ ]:
re.findall(r'\w+', '...foo,,,,bar:%$baz//|')
In [ ]:
 re.findall(r'#(\w+)#', '#foo#.#bar#.#baz#')
In [ ]:
